sentences.sContent: I never felt stiff after training until I was in my thirties.
sentences.sCn: 三十岁之前，我训练后从不会感到身体发僵。

sentences.sContent: The next morning I was as stiff as a board (= very stiff ) .
sentences.sCn: 第二天早上，我感到浑身僵直。

synos.tran: 呆板的；坚硬的；严厉的；拘谨的；拘谨的
死尸；令人讨厌者；[金融]流通票据；劳动者

phrases.pCn: 脖子发僵，斜颈；顽固之人

remMethod.val: still(静止的)的ll变为僵直的ff→僵直的

trans.tranCn: 硬的， 僵直的；拘谨的； 呆板的；艰难的， 费劲的
trans.tranOther: if someone or a part of their body is stiff, their muscles hurt and it is difficult for them to move
